revised_title: Electron Microscopy of Platelets in Artificial Thrombi: Structure and Function
tldr: This study examines the structure and function of platelets in artificial thrombi using electron microscopy. The researchers found that platelets in the white head of the thrombus are closely packed and retain their organelles, while platelets at the periphery have lost their granules. The tight packing and loss of granules occur early in the formation of the thrombus and precede widespread fibrin formation. The study provides insights into the process of blood clotting and the role of platelets in thrombosis.
